Biograph.title: Kai Dove
Biograph.subtitle: Software Engineer
Biograph.description: I am currently pursuing my undergraduate studies at the University of Virginia, with a aspiration to forge a successful career as a software engineer

About.title: About Me
About.subtitle: My Introduction
About.description: I am a fourth-year student majoring in Computer Science at the University of Virginia, pursuing a future in software engineering. In between my studies, I enjoy bringing personal projects to life. Stay connected to track my progress and the innovative projects unfolding along the way.

projects.insideTitle: Investiverse â€“ AI-Powered Stock Learning Platform
projects.description: Tools and Technologies used: \nPHP, JavaScript, PostgreSQL, Docker
details: Developed a full-stack web platform to educate users on financial markets and investment strategies.
Implemented interactive stock exploration, personalized dashboards, and real-time learning modules using dynamic JavaScript and secure session management.
Integrated OAuth-based authentication, community-driven discussions, and investment simulations to support user engagement and financial literacy.

projects.description: Tools and Technologies used: \nPython, CNN, ResNet50, Satellite Imagery
details: Designed a CNN-based geospatial pipeline integrating satellite imagery, terrain, and census data to accurately predict county-level crop yields in Virginia.
Implemented ResNet50 for feature extraction and developed an attention pooling mechanism, reducing regression RMSE by 20% compared to baseline models.
Achieved F1 scores above 0.84 in crop classification, enabling precise crop suitability mapping and optimized resource allocation across counties

projects.description: Tools and Technologies used: Uvicorn, Numpy, Python, FastAPI, Tensorflow
details: Employs a variety of layers like Conv2D, MaxPooling2D, and Conv2DTranspose, along with Dropout for regularization.
FastAPI is used for the web backend, allowing for easy deployment and API endpoint creation.
Additional libraries like OpenCV and NumPy are used for image manipulation, while the dependencies are managed with specific version numbers.
